title: About
section: it will show some detailed information regrading different manufactures
text:
it will show some detailed information regrading different manufactures

More will coming soon…

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

# Generate some sample data
x = np.linspace(0, 2 * np.pi, 100)  # Create an array of values from 0 to 2*pi
y = np.sin(x)  # Compute the sine of each value

# Create a plot
plt.figure(figsize=(8, 4))  # Set the figure size
plt.plot(x, y, label='sin(x)', color='blue', linestyle='-', linewidth=2)  # Create the plot

# Add labels and a legend
plt.xlabel('x')  # X-axis label
plt.ylabel('y')  # Y-axis label
plt.title('Sine Function')  # Title of the plot
plt.legend()

# Show the plot
plt.grid(True)  # Add grid lines
plt.show()

title: About Me
text:
Hi! My name is Xingrui Huo
This is a webpage that introduces me.




Georgetown University, Master of Science, Data Science & Analytics
Geoorgwetown is an excellent unviersity that sits in Georgetown, Washington, D.C.



I spent my undergraduate life at Rutgers, the State University of New Jersey. RU Rah Rah!



Before my undergrad, I stayed back in China for 18 years, born and raised up in the same place.

The area of a circle with radius (r) is given by the formula:
\[
[A = \pi r^2]
\]
Where:

(A) is the area of the circle.
(pi) is approximately 3.14159.
(r) is the radius of the circle.

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

# Generate some data
x = np.linspace(0, 2 * np.pi, 100)
y = np.sin(x)

# Create a plot
plt.figure(figsize=(8, 4))
plt.plot(x, y, label='Sine Wave')
plt.xlabel('x')
plt.ylabel('sin(x)')
plt.legend()
plt.title('Sine Wave Plot')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

title: About Me
text:
Sports
I love to bike, and watch Formula 1 during the weekend. Sometimes I also play the simulator on PC just to have fun, and experience the Formula 1 in a more intuitive way

title: About Me
text:
Things in Life
I like cars, A LOT. I love everything from the design of the car, the engine, transmission of the car, to the difference on configration of the car due to the different law and environmental requirments in different countries. I also have a very strong interest on analyzing anything data-related to the car. I have done a project before, which focuses on analyzing lap time driven by myself in game F1 22. Now I have switched tracks to collect data from real-world, and to see if the data can inspire me in some ways!
